tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE recipe_recommendations (
  user_id INT,
  recipe_id INT,
  ingredient_id INT,
  rating FLOAT,
  PRIMARY KEY (user_id, recipe_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (ingredient_id) REFERENCES ingredients(ingredient_id)
);
CREATE TABLE users ( user_id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE NOT NULL, email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, age INT, location VARCHAR(100) );
CREATE TABLE recipes ( recipe_id INT PRIMARY KEY, recipe_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, difficulty_level INT, prep_time_minutes INT, serving_size INT, user_id INT REFERENCES users(user_id) );
CREATE TABLE ingredients ( ingredient_id INT PRIMARY KEY, ingredient_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, category VARCHAR(50), quantity INT, unit_of_measure VARCHAR(20) );
CREATE TABLE preferences ( preference_id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT REFERENCES users(user_id), ingredient_id INT REFERENCES ingredients(ingredient_id), preference_score INT, timestamp TIMESTAMP );

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50),
    age INT,
    gender VARCHAR(10),
    location VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE recipes (
    recipe_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    recipe_name VARCHAR(100),
    cuisine_type VARCHAR(50),
    prep_time_minutes INT,
    serving_size INT
);

CREATE TABLE ingredients (
    ingredient_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    ingredient_name VARCHAR(50),
    category VARCHAR(50),
    calories_per_100g FLOAT,
    price_per_unit DECIMAL(10, 2)
);

CREATE TABLE user_preferences (
    user_id INT,
    ingredient_id INT,
    preference_score FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (ingredient_id) REFERENCES ingredients(ingredient_id)
);

CREATE TABLE shopping_list (
    user_id INT,
    ingredient_id INT,
    quantity INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (ingredient_id) REFERENCES ingredients(ingredient_id)
);
